Generation I.Red: Because of its ability to slip through block walls, it is said to be from another dimension.
Generation I.Green: (This entry was originally untranslated in English until it was reused in Pokémon FireRed .)
Generation I.Blue: Because of its ability to slip through block walls, it is said to be from another dimension.
Generation I.Yellow: By licking, it saps the victim's life. It causes shaking that won't stop until the victim's demise.
Generation I.Stadium: If you trip and fall for no apparent reason or hear a sound when no one is around, it may be a Haunter .

Generation II.Gold: In total darkness, where nothing is visible, Haunter lurks, silently stalking its next victim.
Generation II.Silver: Its tongue is made of gas. If licked, its victim starts shaking constantly until death eventually comes.
Generation II.Crystal: It hides in the dark, planning to take the life of the next living thing that wanders close by.
Generation II.Stadium 2: In total darkness, where nothing is visible, Haunter lurks, silently stalking its next victim. (Pokémon Red, Silver, or Crystal inserted) Its tongue is made of gas. If licked, its victim starts shaking constantly until death eventually comes. (Pokémon Blue, Gold, or Yellow inserted)

Generation III.Ruby: Haunter is a dangerous Pok é mon . If one beckons you while floating in darkness, you must never approach it. This Pok é mon will try to lick you with its tongue and steal your life away.
Generation III.Sapphire: Haunter is a dangerous Pok é mon . If one beckons you while floating in darkness, you must never approach it. This Pok é mon will try to lick you with its tongue and steal your life away.
Generation III.Emerald: If a Haunter beckons you while it is floating in darkness, don't approach it. This Pok é mon will try to lick you with its tongue and steal your life away.
Generation III.FireRed: If you get the feeling of being watched in darkness when nobody is around, Haunter is there.
Generation III.LeafGreen: Because of its ability to slip through block walls, it is said to be from another dimension.

Generation IV.Diamond: It can slip through any obstacle. It lurks inside walls to keep an eye on its foes.
Generation IV.Pearl: It licks with its gaseous tongue to steal the victim's life force. It lurks in darkness for prey.
Generation IV.Platinum: It likes to lurk in the dark and tap shoulders with a gaseous hand. Its touch causes endless shuddering.
Generation IV.HeartGold: In total darkness, where nothing is visible, Haunter lurks, silently stalking its next victim.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: Its tongue is made of gas. If licked, its victim starts shaking constantly until death eventually comes.

Generation V.Black: It likes to lurk in the dark and tap shoulders with a gaseous hand. Its touch causes endless shuddering.
Generation V.White: It likes to lurk in the dark and tap shoulders with a gaseous hand. Its touch causes endless shuddering.
Generation V.Black 2: It likes to lurk in the dark and tap shoulders with a gaseous hand. Its touch causes endless shuddering.
Generation V.White 2: It likes to lurk in the dark and tap shoulders with a gaseous hand. Its touch causes endless shuddering.

Generation VI.X: If you get the feeling of being watched in darkness when nobody is around, Haunter is there.
Generation VI.Y: It licks with its gaseous tongue to steal the victim's life force. It lurks in darkness for prey.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: Haunter is a dangerous Pokémon. If one beckons you while floating in darkness, you must never approach it. This Pokémon will try to lick you with its tongue and steal your life away.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: Haunter is a dangerous Pokémon. If one beckons you while floating in darkness, you must never approach it. This Pokémon will try to lick you with its tongue and steal your life away.

Generation VII.Sun: It strikes at humans from total darkness. Those licked by its cold tongue grow weaker with each passing day until they die.
Generation VII.Moon: It fears the light and revels in the dark. It may be on the verge of extinction in cities that stay brightly lit at night.
Generation VII.Ultra Sun: On moonless nights, Haunter searches for someone to curse, so it's best not to go out walking around.
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: It's dangerous to go outside alone on nights when you're feeling sad. Haunter will catch you, and you won't be able to go back home.
Generation VII.Let's Go Pikachu: By licking, it saps the victim's life. It causes shaking that won't stop until the victim's demise.
Generation VII.Let's Go Eevee: By licking, it saps the victim's life. It causes shaking that won't stop until the victim's demise.

Generation VIII.Sword: Its tongue is made of gas. If licked, its victim starts shaking constantly until death eventually comes.
Generation VIII.Shield: If you get the feeling of being watched in darkness when nobody is around, Haunter is there.
Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: It can slip through any obstacle. It lurks inside walls to keep an eye on its foes.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: It licks with its gaseous tongue to steal its victim's life-force. It lurks in darkness, waiting for prey.
Generation VIII.Legends: Arceus: This frightful, malevolent spirit can glide through walls, appearing wherever it likes. According to rumor, victims of a Haunter's lick will wither to death day by day.

Generation IX.Scarlet: It likes to lurk in the dark and tap shoulders with a gaseous hand. Its touch causes endless shuddering.
Generation IX.Violet: In total darkness, where nothing is visible, Haunter lurks, silently stalking its next victim.
